title: Most Widely Grown Crop
description: Maize is the most widely grown crop in terms of production volume.

title: Rice is Key
description: Rice is the main food for more than half of the world's population.

title: Wheat Varieties
description: There are around 30,000 varieties of wheat.

title: Honey Never Spoils
description: Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still edible.

title: Sheep Recognize Faces
description: Sheep can recognize human faces, even after years of separation.

title: Peanuts are Not Nuts
description: Peanuts are legumes, part of the same family as beans and lentils.

title: A Cow's Dairy Production
description: A single cow can produce 200,000 glasses of milk in its lifetime.

title: Apples Float
description: Apples are made up of 25% air, which is why they can float in water.

title: Chickens and Dinosaurs
description: Chickens are the closest living relatives to the Tyrannosaurus Rex.
